sen.j: 樂 吉左衛門（らく きちざえもん）は、千家十職の一つ、楽焼の茶碗を作る茶碗師の樂家が代々襲名している名称である。
sen.e: Kichizaemon RAKU is a name inherited from generation to generation by the leader of the Raku family of chawanshi (tea bowl maker) who makes Raku-yaki ware, which is one of the Senke jissoku (Senke's ten designated craftsmen families).

Kichizaemon RAKU is a name inherited from generation to generation by the leader of the Raku family of chawanshi (tea bowl maker) who makes Raku-yaki ware, which is one of the Senke jissoku (Senke's ten designated craftsmen families).

Kichizaemon RAKU is a name inherited from generation to generation by the leader of the Raku family of chawanshi (tea bowl maker) who makes Raku-yaki ware, which is one of the Senke jissoku (Senke's ten designated craftsmen families).

sen.j: 2007年現在、15代（1949年-、1980年に襲名）が当主である。
sen.e: Today in 2007, the fifteenth (1949-, succeeded in 1980) is the leader.
As of 2007, the fifteenth (1949-, succeeded in 1980) is the leader.
As of 2007, the fifteenth (1949-, succeeded in 1980) is the leader.

sen.j: 系譜については特にその初期について諸説があった。
sen.e: There are various opinions on the genealogy especially around the beginning.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: There were various opinions on the genealogy especially around the beginning.
There were various opinions on the genealogy especially around the beginning.

sen.j: 今日では1955年に14代（覚入）が発表した統一見解が公式的に受け入れられている。
sen.e: Today, the consensus opinion announced in 1955 by the fourteenth (Kakunyu) is accepted officially.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Today, the consensus opinion announced in 1955 by the fourteenth (Kakunyu) is accepted officially.
Today, the consensus opinion announced in 1955 by the fourteenth (Kakunyu) is accepted officially.

sen.j: 以下もそれに従う。
sen.e: The following description also follows this opinion.
The following description also follows this opinion.
The following description also follows this opinion.

sen.j: 3代・道入以降の各当主には隠居した時に「入」の字を含む入道号という名前が贈られる。
sen.e: Leaders of Donyu the third and after, are given a name called Nyudo-go (nyudo: lay-monk, go: pseudonym) which includes the Kanji of "Nyu" when retired.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Donyu the 3rd and the leaders following Donyu the 3rd are given a name called Nyudo-go (nyudo: lay-monk, go: pseudonym) which includes the Kanji of "入" (Nyu) when they are retired.
Donyu the 3rd and the leaders following Donyu the 3rd are given a name called Nyudo-go (nyudo: lay-monk, go: pseudonym) which includes the Kanji of "入" (Nyu) when they are retired.

sen.j: 後世にはその名前で呼ばれる事が多い。
sen.e: They often called by these names in after ages.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: They often called by these names after they have passed away.
They often called by these names after they have passed away.

sen.j: なお、道入・得入・惺入・覚入は没後に贈られている。
sen.e: Incidentally, the names Donyu, Tokunyu, Seinyu, and Kakunyu were given after death.
Incidentally, the names Donyu, Tokunyu, Seinyu, and Kakunyu were given after death.
Incidentally, the names Donyu, Tokunyu, Seinyu, and Kakunyu were given after death.

sen.j: 樂家初代の長次郎（ちょうじろう）は、楽焼の創設者である中国出身の父・あめや（飴屋または飴也）と母・比丘尼の間に生まれた。
sen.e: Chojiro the first leader of the Raku family was born between the father Ameya from China who was the originator of the Raku-yaki and the mother who was a bikuni (female Buddhist disciple)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Chojiro, the first leader of the Raku family was born between the father Ameya from China who was the originator of the Raku-yaki and the mother who was a bikuni (female Buddhist disciple).
sen.cmt: Chijiroの直後にカンマ、文の最後にピリオドを追加
sen.e: Chojiro, the first leader of the Raku family was born between the father Ameya from China who was the originator of the Raku-yaki and the mother who was a bikuni (female Buddhist disciple).

sen.j: 樂家の代名詞ともなる黒釉をかけた茶碗の作製において非常に優れた技量を見せた。
sen.e: He brought out the expertise to create tea bowls covered with kuroyu (black glaze), which became synonym of the RAKU family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He brought out the expertise to create tea bowls covered with kuroyu (black glaze), which became a synonym for the RAKU family.
He brought out the expertise to create tea bowls covered with kuroyu (black glaze), which became a synonym for the RAKU family.

sen.j: 没後、長次郎の妻の祖父・田中宗慶が豊臣秀吉から聚楽第の一字を取った「樂」の黄金の印を与えられた。
sen.e: After Chojiro's death, Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI gave a golden seal with one kanji character "Raku" derived from Characters of Jurakudai (name of Hideyoshi's residence) to the grand father of Chojiro's wife Sokei TANAKA.

After Chojiro's death, Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI gave a golden seal with one kanji character "樂" (raku) derived from the characters of Jurakudai (name of Hideyoshi's residence) to the grandfather of Chojiro's wife Sokei TANAKA.

After Chojiro's death, Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI gave a golden seal with one kanji character "樂" (raku) derived from the characters of Jurakudai (name of Hideyoshi's residence) to the grandfather of Chojiro's wife Sokei TANAKA.

sen.j: これが樂家の始まりである。
sen.e: This was the origin of the Raku family.
This was the origin of the Raku family.
This was the origin of the Raku family.

sen.j: 宗慶は千利休と同じ田中性を持ち、利休にかなり近い存在であったと考えられている。
sen.e: It is thought that as Sokei had the same family name of TANAKA as SEN no Rikyu, he had near relation to Rikyu.
It is thought that as Sokei had the same family name of TANAKA as SEN no Rikyu, he had a close relation to Rikyu.
It is thought that as Sokei had the same family name of TANAKA as SEN no Rikyu, he had a close relation to Rikyu.

sen.j: 宗慶とその長男・宗味（長次郎の義父）は樂家の制作活動に深く関わっていたが、前政権の秀吉と親しかったことを慮り、宗慶の次男・楽常慶（じょうけい）が樂家の2代となった。
sen.e: Although Sokei and his first son Somi (Chojiro's father in law) involved deeply with the creation activity of the Raku family, Jokei RAKU the second son of Sokei became the second leader of the RAKU family because it was felt delicate that Sokei and Somi had been intimate with Hideyoshi of the previous administration.

Although Sokei and his first son Somi (Chojiro's father in law) involved deeply in the creation activity of the Raku family, Jokei RAKU the second son of Sokei became the second leader of the RAKU family because it was thought to be a delicate matter that Sokei and Somi had a friendly relationship with Hideyoshi of the previous administration.
sen.cmt: involved deeply with --> involved deeply in, it was felt delicate that Sokei and Somi had been intimate --> it was thought to be a delicate matter that Sokei and Somi had a friendly relationship
sen.e: Although Sokei and his first son Somi (Chojiro's father in law) involved deeply in the creation activity of the Raku family, Jokei RAKU the second son of Sokei became the second leader of the RAKU family because it was thought to be a delicate matter that Sokei and Somi had a friendly relationship with Hideyoshi of the previous administration.

sen.j: その後、常慶は初めて吉左衛門を名乗る。
sen.e: After that Jokei took the name Kichizaemon for the first time.
After that Jokei took the name Kichizaemon for the first time.
After that Jokei took the name Kichizaemon for the first time.

sen.j: 本阿弥光悦のとりなしもあって江戸幕府との関係は良好で、芝・増上寺の徳川秀忠の墓には常慶作の香炉が埋葬されていた。
sen.e: The relation with the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) was good partly because of intercession by Koetsu HONAMI, and a koro (incense burner) made by Jokei had been buried in the grave of Hidetada TOKUGAWA at the Shiba Zojo-ji temple.

The relation with the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) was good due to intercession by Koetsu HONAMI, and a koro (incense burner) made by Jokei was buried in the grave of Hidetada TOKUGAWA at the Shiba Zojo-ji temple.

The relation with the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) was good due to intercession by Koetsu HONAMI, and a koro (incense burner) made by Jokei was buried in the grave of Hidetada TOKUGAWA at the Shiba Zojo-ji temple.

sen.j: 3代を継いだのは常慶の長男・道入（どうにゅう）である。
sen.e: The leader was succeeded as the third by Donyu the first son of Jokei.
The leader was succeeded as the third by Donyu the first son of Jokei.
The leader was succeeded as the third by Donyu the first son of Jokei.

sen.j: 道入は別名（俗称）・のんこう、またはノンカウとも言われる楽焼の名人で、樂家の釉薬の技法を完成させたとまで言われている。
sen.e: Donyu, also called Nonko or Nonkau as familiar name, was an expert of Raku-yaki and even said that he perfected the technique of glaze.
Donyu, also called Nonko or Nonkau, was an expert of Raku-yaki and is even said that he perfected the technique of glaze.
sen.cmt: 時制の調整、表現の見直し
sen.e: Donyu, also called Nonko or Nonkau, was an expert of Raku-yaki and is even said that he perfected the technique of glaze.

sen.j: また長次郎以外では唯一吉左衛門を名乗らず、吉兵衛と名乗った。
sen.e: Incidentally, Donyu, who took the name "Kichibe", was the only one leader who did not take the name Kichizaemon except the case of Chojiro.
Incidentally, except for Chojiro, Donyu, who took the name "Kichibe", was the only leader who did not take the name Kichizaemon.
Incidentally, except for Chojiro, Donyu, who took the name "Kichibe", was the only leader who did not take the name Kichizaemon.

sen.j: 以後、歴代の当主が様々な作品を作り、今日の15代に至っている。
sen.e: After that successive leaders through the fifteenth of today have created various works

sen.j: 大降りでゆがみのある茶碗、「香炉釉」と呼ばれる白釉の使用を始める。
sen.e: He began to make tea bowls of large and distorted shape, and to use white glaze called koro-yu (glaze of incense burner).

sen.j: 初代や二代とは全く異なる、朱色、黄色など多数の釉薬を使用する明るい作風が特徴。
sen.e: His specialty was the brilliant style using various glaze including vermilion and yellow, which was completely different from that of the first and the second.

sen.j: 初代を模範としつつ、父の技法を取り入れ、地味な色調の中に光沢を持つ作風を特徴とする。
sen.e: His specialty was the style having brilliance on the quiet tone, which he created with the works of the first leader as a role model and brought the technique of his father.

sen.e: In the period of increasing of the Sado population even to townspeople, he also created many works other than tea bowls including kogo (incense container) and hanaire (vase).

sen.j: しかし、病弱のため、父の死後に弟に家督を譲り隠居、「佐兵衛」と改名。
sen.e: But after his father's death, he transferred the head of the family to his younger brother because of his sickliness and took a name Sahe when he retired.

sen.e: In 1825, he retired and moved to Ishiyama, Omi Province, then took life easy.

sen.j: 表千家9代・了々斎と共に紀州徳川家に伺候、「偕楽園窯」開設に貢献。
sen.e: He visited the Kishu Tokugawa Family with the ninth grand master of Omote Sen-ke, Ryoryosai and contributed to construct the Kairakuen kiln.

sen.j: その功績により文政9（1826年）、徳川治宝より「樂」字を拝領。
sen.e: For these merits, he was bestowed a character "Raku" from Harutomi TOKUGAWA in 1826.

sen.j: 作風は織部焼、伊賀焼、瀬戸焼などの作風や意匠を取り入れ、技巧的で華やかとされる。

sen.e: The third son of Naohachi OGAWA, a sake brewer of Chitose village, Minami kuwada county, Tanba Province (present day, Chitose-cho, Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture).
The third son of Naohachi OGAWA, a sake brewer of Chitose village, Minami kuwada county, Tanba Province (present day, Chitose-cho, Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture).
The third son of Naohachi OGAWA, a sake brewer of Chitose village, Minami kuwada county, Tanba Province (present day, Chitose-cho, Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture).

sen.j: 十代婿養子。
sen.e: He was adopted by the family of his wife, who was a daughter of the tenth leader.
He was adopted by the family of his wife, who was a daughter of the tenth leader.
He was adopted by the family of his wife, who was a daughter of the tenth leader.

sen.j: 弘化2（1845年）に家督相続。
sen.e: In 1845, he succeeded to the position of family head.
In 1845, he succeeded to the position of family head.
In 1845, he succeeded to the position of family head.

sen.j: 明治維新後、茶道低迷期の中、旧大名家の華族に作品を納めるなど家業維持に貢献。
sen.e: In the period of doldrums of the Sado after the Meiji Restoration, he contributed to maintain the family business by efforts such as to offer works to the nobilities of former-daimyo.
In the doldrums of Sado after the Meiji Restoration, he contributed to maintain the family business by efforts such as to offer works to the nobilities of former-daimyo.
sen.cmt: In the period of doldrums of the Sado--> In the doldrums of Sado
sen.e: In the doldrums of Sado after the Meiji Restoration, he contributed to maintain the family business by efforts such as to offer works to the nobilities of former-daimyo.

sen.j: 十二代 弘入（安政4（1857年） - 昭和7年（1932年））
sen.e: The twelfth Konyu (1857-1932).
The twelfth Konyu (1857-1932)
The twelfth Konyu (1857-1932)

sen.j: 十一代長男。
sen.e: The first son of the eleventh.
The first son of the eleventh.
The first son of the eleventh.

sen.j: 明治4年に家督相続する。
sen.e: In 1871, he succeeded to the position of family head.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 1871, he succeeded to the position of family head.
In 1871, he succeeded to the position of family head.

sen.j: 茶道衰退期のため若いときの作品は少なく、晩年になって多数の作品を制作する。
sen.e: He left few works at his youth because Sado was in a period of decay, but he made many woks at his last years.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He left few works in his youth because Sado was on a decline, but he made many woks in his last years.
He left few works in his youth because Sado was on a decline, but he made many woks in his last years.

sen.j: 大胆なへら使いに特徴があるとされる。
sen.e: It is said that his specialty was in bold paddle work.
It is said that his specialty was in bold paddle work.
It is said that his specialty was in bold paddle work.

sen.j: 大正8年（1919年）に隠居、以後は京都本邸と九代の別荘であった滋賀県の石山を往復し、優雅な晩年を送る。
sen.e: After he retired in 1919, he took life easy staying in the family residence in Kyoto or the country house in Ishiyama, Shiga Prefecture.
After he retired in 1919, he took life easy staying in the family residence in Kyoto or the country house in Ishiyama, Shiga Prefecture.
After he retired in 1919, he took life easy staying in the family residence in Kyoto or the country house in Ishiyama, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 十三代 惺入（明治20年（1887年） - 昭和19年（1944年））
sen.e: The thirteenth Seinyu (1887-1944).
The thirteenth Seinyu (1887-1944)
The thirteenth Seinyu (1887-1944)

sen.j: 十二代長男。
sen.e: The first son of the twelfth.
The first son of the twelfth.
The first son of the twelfth.

sen.j: 釉薬、技法の研究を歴代中最も熱心に行い、また、樂家家伝の研究を行う。
sen.e: He studied about glaze and technique most eagerly among the successive leaders, and about the kaden (hereditary learning) of the RAKU family.
He studied glaze and technique most eagerly among the successive leaders, and also studied kaden (hereditary learning) of the RAKU family.
sen.cmt: studied aboutをstudied にするなど表現の見直し
sen.e: He studied glaze and technique most eagerly among the successive leaders, and also studied kaden (hereditary learning) of the RAKU family.

sen.j: 昭和10年（1935年） - 昭和17年（1942年）にそれらの研究結果を『茶道せゝらぎ』という雑誌を刊行し発表。
sen.e: He published a magazine "Sado Seseragi" (stream of Sado) during 1935 to 1942 to present achievement of these studies.
He published a magazine "Sado Seseragi" (stream of Sado) during 1935 to 1942 to present achievement of these studies.
He published a magazine "Sado Seseragi" (stream of Sado) during 1935 to 1942 to present achievement of these studies.

sen.j: しかし晩年に太平洋戦争が勃発、跡継ぎである長男も応召、研究も作陶も物資不足の中困難となった。
sen.e: In his last years, as the Pacific War began, his first son the successor was called up for military service, and it became difficult to continue studies and making pottery due to insufficient supplies
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In his last years, as the Pacific War began, his first son the successor was called up for military service, and it became difficult to continue studies and making pottery due to insufficient supplies

In his last years, as the Pacific War began, his first son the successor was called up for military service, and it became difficult to continue studies and making pottery due to insufficient supplies

sen.j: 閉塞する中没した。
sen.e: He died in such a stagnation.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He died in such a stagnating condition.
He died in such a stagnating condition.

sen.j: 十四代 覚入（大正7年（1918年） - 昭和55年（1980年））
sen.e: The fourteenth Kakunyu (1918-1980).
The fourteenth Kakunyu (1918-1980)
The fourteenth Kakunyu (1918-1980)

sen.j: 十三代長男。
sen.e: The first son of the thirteenth.
The first son of the thirteenth.
The first son of the thirteenth.

sen.j: 昭和15年（1940年）、東京美術学校（現東京芸術大学）彫刻科卒。
sen.e: In 1940, he graduated the department of sculpture of the Tokyo School of Fine Arts (present Tokyo University of Arts).
In 1940, he graduated the department of sculpture of the Tokyo School of Fine Arts (present Tokyo University of Arts).
In 1940, he graduated the department of sculpture of the Tokyo School of Fine Arts (present Tokyo University of Arts).

sen.j: 卒業後、応召され従軍。
sen.e: After graduate, he was called up for military service.
After graduation, he was called up for military service.
After graduation, he was called up for military service.

sen.j: 昭和20年（1945年）に生還するも、前年に父が死去、茶道も低迷期を迎えていた。
sen.e: When he came home alive in 1945, his father already died in the previous year and Sado was in a period of decay.
When he came home alive in 1945, his father had already died in the previous year and Sado was on a decline.
sen.cmt: died --> had died, in a period of decay --> on a decline
sen.e: When he came home alive in 1945, his father had already died in the previous year and Sado was on a decline.

sen.j: 好景気となる昭和35年（1960年）以降、作品が充実するようになる。
sen.e: After 1960, in the period of economic boom, his work gained affluence.
After 1960, in the period of economic boom, his work gained affluence.
After 1960, in the period of economic boom, his work gained affluence.

sen.j: 彫刻の理論を生かした立体的造形は他代には見られない特徴とされる。
sen.e: It is said that his specialty of steric design by using the theory of sculpture is unique among other successive leaders.
It is said that his specialty of steric design by using the theory of sculpture is unique among other successive leaders.
It is said that his specialty of steric design by using the theory of sculpture is unique among other successive leaders.

sen.j: 昭和53年（1978年）、樂家歴代史料を基に「樂美術館」開設。
sen.e: In 1978, he set up the Raku Museum based on the historical materials inherited by successive leaders.
In 1978, he set up the Raku Museum based on the historical materials inherited by successive leaders.
In 1978, he set up the Raku Museum based on the historical materials inherited by successive leaders.

sen.j: 同年文化庁より人間国宝指定される。
sen.e: In the same year, he was designated as the Living National Treasure by the Agency for Cultural Affairs.
In the same year, he was designated as the Living National Treasure by the Agency for Cultural Affairs.
In the same year, he was designated as the Living National Treasure by the Agency for Cultural Affairs.

sen.j: 今後のさらなる活躍が期待されたが、2年後急逝。
sen.e: Although his further activity was expected, he died suddenly two years later.
Although his further activity was expected, he died suddenly two years later.
Although his further activity was expected, he died suddenly two years later.

sen.j: 十五代 樂吉左衛門（昭和24年（1949年）-）※当代
sen.e: The fifteenth Kichizaemon RAKU (1949-), present leader.
The fifteenth Kichizaemon RAKU (1949-), present leader.
The fifteenth Kichizaemon RAKU (1949-), present leader.

sen.j: 本名「光博」。
sen.e: Real name is Mitsuhiro.
Real name is Mitsuhiro.
Real name is Mitsuhiro.

sen.j: 京都府立朱雀高等学校、東京芸術大学彫刻科卒。
sen.e: Graduated Kyoto Prefectural Suzaku Senior High School, then the department of sculpture of the Tokyo University of Arts.
Graduated Kyoto Prefectural Suzaku Senior High School, then the department of sculpture of the Tokyo University of Arts.
Graduated Kyoto Prefectural Suzaku Senior High School, then the department of sculpture of the Tokyo University of Arts.

sen.j: イタリアローマ・アカデミア留学。
sen.e: Studied at the Rome Academia in Italy.
Studied at the Rome Academia in Italy.
Studied at the Rome Academia in Italy.
Succeeded the name in November, 1981.
Succeeded the name in November, 1981.
Succeeded the name in November, 1981.

sen.j: 日本国内外で数々の賞を受賞し、単なる職人としてではなく「陶芸作家」としての評価も高い。
sen.e: He has received various prizes from home and abroad, and also received high evaluation as a "ceramic artist" not as just a craft worker.
He has received various prizes from home and abroad, and also received high evaluation as a "ceramic artist" not as just a craft worker.
He has received various prizes from home and abroad, and also received high evaluation as a "ceramic artist" not as just a craft worker.

sen.j: 1997年に織部賞を受賞。
sen.e: In 1997, he received the Oribe prize.
In 1997, he received the Oribe prize.
In 1997, he received the Oribe prize.
